column1: Valery Ilyich Rozhdestvensky (Russian: ??????? ????? ??????????????, born February 13, 1939 in Leningrad, Russian SFSR; died August 31, 2011) was a USSR cosmonaut.
Rozhdestvensky was born in Leningrad and graduated from the Higher Military Engineering School of Soviet Navy in Pushkin in engineering.

column2: From 1961 to 1965 he was commander of deepsea diving unity in the Baltic Sea War Fleet.

column1: Rozhdestvensky was selected as a cosmonaut on October 23, 1965 and flew as Flight Engineer on Soyuz 23.

column2: After his space flight he continued to work with the space program at the Yuri Gagarin Cosmonaut Training Center.

column1: He retired on June 24, 1986 and worked with Metropolis Industries.
He was married with one child.
